title.rendered: 4 Animal Translator Apps To Understand Your Furry Friends

content.rendered:
We, at Translate By Humans, have been helping humans understand each other across the world. So, we thought, why not extend our special services for your furry friends too? Oh wait, no – we’re not starting animal translation services (sorry Blackie). Instead, this is just a nifty list to help you discover apps made to aid human-animal communication. Are you ready to become a purr-fect co-moo-nicator? Cat & Dog Translator Offered by: Petmoji tools Available on: Google Playstore Did he say ‘woof’ or ‘wuoof’? Just press a button, record the sound, and voila – it’s like your pet is speaking English! This app helps you communicate with dogs and cats of various breeds and understand their sounds. It has some additional features, too.

Open next page to continue reading

Cat & Dog Translator

The Animal Translator is an Android application which can easily let you know what your pets want to communicate with you. Application first launched on the April Fool’s Day is now a reality. This application is quite simple and easy to handle. As you go through the application, select the pet which you have and hold it up to your pet and once the voice recorder is ON it will record the voice and the application will translate whatever your pet’s is saying in written English language.
Open next page to continue reading

Did he say ‘woof’ or ‘wuoof’?

Just press a button, record the sound, and voila – it’s like your pet is speaking English! This app helps you communicate with dogs and cats of various breeds and understand their sounds. It has some additional features, too. Cat/Dog Simulator: The app collects real animal sounds and simulates them for every mood – hungry, angry, frightened, etc. Just a click and you’ll magically speak ‘meow’ and ‘woof’. Pet Album: It’s no secret – all pet owners are obsessed with their animal partners (Ruju’s phone has millions of pictures of Blackie and Ginger). This app helps you store, categorise, and edit your pet’s pictures, all in one place. MeowTalk Cat Translator Offered by: Akvelon Inc Available on: Google Playstore and App Store Did you know that your cat’s ‘meow’ might not be the same as your neighbour’s cat’s ‘meow’? It is possible. Just like your English might not be the same as my English. MeowTalk recognises this and uses machine learning to decode your cat’s sounds. It then translates them into the human language (for you to read).
Open next page to continue reading

Cat & Dog Translator

Just press a button, record the sound, and voila – it’s as if your pet speaks English! This application helps you to communicate with dogs and cats of different breeds and understand their sounds. It also has some additional features.

Cat / Dog Simulator: The app collects and simulates real animal sounds for every mood – hungry, angry, afraid, etc. With just one click, “meow” and “woof” will magically speak.
Pet scrapbook: It’s no secret – all pet owners are obsessed with their pet partners (Ruju’s phone has millions of photos of Blackie and Ginger). This app helps you store, categorize and edit your pet’s photos, all in one place.

Open next page to continue reading

MeowTalk Cat Translator

Did you know that your cat’s “meow” may not be the same as the “meow” of your neighbor’s cat? It is possible. Just like your English may not be like my English. MeowTalk recognizes this and uses machine learning to decode your cat’s voices. Then he translates it into human language (for you to read).

The app categorizes sounds into nine intentions (or moods) for your cat:

In Pain
Happy/Content
Resting
Defence
Angry
Mating Call
Attack
Hunting
Mother Call
What then? It can also help you understand your cat’s meow. For example, if you add some examples of a specific sound and what that means for your cat, the app learns and starts to recognize that sound. As you learn more about your cat, so does the app.

Talk to the Dog – Pet Translator

What’s the perfect way to prank a dog lover? Well, bark and meat! Like other apps, this app also helps you translate your dog’s voices. It also allows you to translate your words into barks and verses. Just press “Register” and say something – the app translates your dog.
It might be the most fun thing to do with your pet. Play these sounds and see their response. On the other hand, you can also discuss with them “why not respect the meal and sleep schedules that I set for you”. ultimately.

Wait, that’s not all. We have another suggested app that doesn’t help you interpret your pet’s sounds, but instead helps you see the world through their eyes. We thought you might like a little bonus.🙂

Open next page to continue reading
